name: InterContinental Chicago O'Hare

reviews.text: This hotel is absolutely beautiful. I was excited at check-in the painting at the front desk just looked relaxing. I went to the conference reception dinner - food was great. I went back to my room to relax & read. Because I"m a bit neurotic I always check the bed for bed bugs. I just DETEST insects so it's something I always do. I tore the bed apart (as I always do) and felt satisfied all was good. I snuggled into the very very comfy bed with my book. I fell asleep reading & around 1:30AM woke up. I got a drink of water & came back to bed to find a bug on my pillow. At first I thought it was just a small cockroach - gross, but no big deal. Then I put my glasses back on & realized it was a bed bug. I caught in in tisssue & killed it. I left in the bathroom sink for the manager to look at. I called down to the front desk & the sent someone up right away. He took the bug away & I said I needed to move - he said he see what he could do. The overnight manager & the assistant manager both showed up at my room not 10 minutes later - the assistant manager confirmed it was a bed bug. They both apologized profusely. They helped me move all my things out, put me 5 floors away in a suite, helped me check out my luggage in the new room. They called twice more that night to check on me. They comped me internet/movies & breakfast. The day manager called later to tell me they already had a company that specializes in bed bug extermination in the room fixing the problem. She also said there had been a large international conference the week before & that room had an individual from over-seas in it. I was still too freaked to sleep in the new bed in the new room (cuz I'm a bug phobe) and just slept on top with the washable throw blanket. Luckily the suite bathrooms are huge (and awesome!) so I kept all my luggage in the bathroom on hard surfaces. They did everything they could to make up for the issue. I was not bitten & we only saw two bugs total in the room. The mattress was clean other wise as were the feather bed & comforter. So, it was probably a very very isolated incident. However, thought I would put it out there for the "good of the order." Stellar customer service during the whole issue by everyone involved.
reviews.title: Beautiful until the Bed Bug appeared - management quick to help though

reviews.text: Stayed for just one night and a one day meeting. The rooms were clean and quiet and accomodating. The food was poor. Both room servce (hamburger) and conference food was mediocre. There is a McCormicks and should have gone there. The meeting room was OK. There a refridge stocked with alcohol, drinks, and treats. There is a nice coffee bar with Illy coffee in the lobby.
reviews.title: One night stand by Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sorry for the late review but my husband and I stayed here on January 2 of this year. We had a one night honeymoon and booked here because the prices were so much better than in the city. We were upgraded to a suite....really cool because if has a living room overlooking the forest preserve,small bar area and a half bath. This hotel is very new and all features in the room were sleek and modern. Wait until you check out the bathroom with the Kohler tub, rainfall shower,and dual column-like sinks. The managemnt also sent up a full bottle of red wine and a selection of hand dipped chocolates.
reviews.title: Modern, Sleek and Affordable...........loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check out the sheets.............they smell like fresh baked bread....not sure how they did it but we slept like babies. We enjoyed our visit and will be back.
reviews.title: Quiet and pleasant and not THAT far from downtown

reviews.text: We booked this hotel after getting a cut-rate on a travel website. Overall, we were impressed with the quality of the room and service. Definitely had a luxurious feel and was a great place to relax, very clean and quiet. As far as value, well, don't go to a four-star hotel looking for value. Nothing here is complimentary (wait, maybe the shoe shine service was free, I don't know), and there are very few options for travelers on a budget when it comes to food. We had a car and paid $22 a day to park it, so we were able to drive away from the hotel restaurant and find something cheaper. The in-room fridge was stocked with $5 cans of Coke, and internet access is $12 a day.
reviews.title: Nice, clean, quiet, but...

reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful, and it doesn't hurt that it is only a few months old. Easily the 2nd best hotel I’ve ever been in, and I've been in quite a few. Service was great. Easy to get to if you are flying in from the O'Hare airport, and great for a conference. But not an easy location if you want to visit downtown. Even if you are just staying at this hotel because you are visiting the city, traveling to/from isn’t that awkward – but, it will take 30-60 minutes to get downtown. Service is incredible. Food is OK -- better than average hotel food, but still a bit boring for vegetarians. Nearby restaurants are meat-heavy. I did appreciate the care they gave to keeping room-service food hot and presentable. Appointments in the hotel are beautiful, clean, comfortable, and imaginative. Some failures in the small details (i.e. beautiful pieces in the bathroom, but failure to put a collar over the pipes). Fortunate enough to have a view from my room that overlooked a forest preserve, across from which you can see the city skyline. Ask for a room that faces that skyline. They do rip you off for internet access, of course, as all hotels do. Just give it free, people - we know it doesn't cost you anything.
reviews.title: Easily the second-best hotel I've EVER been in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel via Hotwire for its good rate and positive review. Hotel is elegent with museum-like lobby and conference room. For a 5-star hotel, I'm a bit disappointed that it doesn't have a swimming pool. Overall it's a very impressive hotel to stay.
reviews.title: A very artistic contemporary hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for a wedding. The hotel is HUGE with a nice big lobby and friendly bell hops and front desk personnel. Our room was large and spotless, with a huge bathroom which I loved. The bench in the bathroom, the glass shower which was very roomy, the huge sink counter, all was great. The receptionist downstairs was also very helpful when we had questions. The only negative is that it is SO far away from downtown but that's expected. Otherwise we had a great stay here.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were put up in the Intercontinental by United and were very pleasantly surprised. In fact, the Incontinental salvaged what had been a miserable day, and my wife and I turned misfortune into a mini-vacation. Lets start with the physical hotel. The lobby is starkly elegant, with a giant painting depicting model airplanes against a blue sky as the checkin area backdrop. The staff were cool and professional, and checkin was effortless. The room was gorgeous, with wonderful design touches from the sink to the light fixtures. The bed was extraordinarily comfortable, the shower was like a rainfall, and the towels and robes were plush and soft.
reviews.title: Fantastic room, service and food

reviews.text: We ordered room service, and the food was absolutely superb. This is not rose-colored hindsight, the room service fare was actually fantastic. We placed our order at 11:30pm, and received the food at 12:10am. We ordered their pasta dish, a salad and the soup of the day. The pasta was amazing, hot, fresh, with well-cooked pasta, crisp, flavorful vegetables, with a pesto sauce in need of no seasoning. The salad was also wonderfully crisp, fresh and flavorful. Finally, the minestrone was excellent, in need of no extra seasoning, with a rich broth and perfectly cooked vegetables.
reviews.title: very nice hotel, staff was less than welcoming

reviews.text: This hotel close to Chicago's O'Hare Airport was a convenient choice for a business meeting with participants from around the country. The free shuttle comes by the shuttle area of the airport every 20 minutes. The hotel is new--about 9 months old from what I heard--and very modern. Spa-like colors--dark an earthy--predominate, and all areas of the hotel that I was in are squeaky clean. My large junior suite had a comfie king-size bed with 5 feather pillows, 4 reading reading lights, and an alarm clock which I had no idea how to use but which apparently works with an iPod. You do have to hunt for the coffee pot--in the cabinet under the tv on a pull-out tray. There's an in-room safe, too. There was a sitting area but it was not particularly cozy due to the very spare, angular design of the furniture. The color scheme was quite dark, and even with all the lights on, the dark furnishings and walls sucked up the light. I suppose some find that soothing and spa-like, but I prefer light and airy myself. The bathroom was large with lots of chrome and glass. The huge glass shower has a single large showerhead of the "rain shower" type. In discussing the rooms with colleagues, we panned the shower--there's a reason most showerheads come out of the wall at an angle and it has to do with basic anatomy. Also, many of us struggled with the bathroom faucet, unable to figure out how to turn it on. One woman struggled for 10 minutes and was on the verge of calling the front desk but turned it one by accident. I played around with it for about 5 minutes and I too, nearly called the front desk. The trick is to pull just the handle, not the whole knob, towards you. Sounds simple, right? Ha! The art work throughout the hotel was pretty amazing and mostly showcased modern artists' work--some lesser known and some whose names you'll recognize. The meetings rooms were perfect--check out the giant rose-petal lights in the ceilings! The staff was spectacular--housekeeping, room service, food servers at the meeting, front-desk, even shuttle drivers. They were friendly, helpful, easy to find, and smart. The management of the hotel clearly "gets" that customer service is key to a happy guest who will return again and recommend the hotel to others. The hotel gave us a really good deal for our meeting--rooms were areound $130/night, which is a steal considering how nice the place is. There's a McCormick & Schmicks a few steps from the hotel--a restaurant which I always enjoy though I didn't get a chance to go to this one. The food I tried from a rather limited room service menu as well as the food that the hotel prepared for the meeting was rather bland, with too-large servings of pasta and poor presentation. They definitely need to upgrade the chef's skills, recipes, and presentation--it's not difficult or expensive to do an eye-catching presentation. The exceptions to the so-so food were a lovely cream of asparagus soup and a flourless chocolate cake. The light techo music that plays throughout the hotel was a bit annoying, though at least it wasn't loud. Younger people might find appealing. I could even hear it in the meetings rooms when the doors were open. Overall, I found the hotel to be a real bargain and an excellent choice for a centrally located meeting involving national clients who are flying in from all over the states, like ours. It was roundly applauded by our clients, who usually have to leave our conferences early to get flights at reasonable times, but with it's proximity to the airport, only a few people had to leave before the meeting finished. BTW, I could sometimes hear jets flying over from the lobby, but not from any other part of the hotel. None of the clients complained about airport noise, so they seemed to have sound-proofed the hotel extremely well. In short, highly recommended.
reviews.title: Colleagues and clients raved about this artsy, reasonably-priced hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is outstanding in all it has to offer. Staff is very courteous and the rooms are spacious and very well laid out. Bathrooms are roomy with excellent rain showers. IPOD docks, personal single pod coffee maker and everything else that you may need for your stay. I love the lobby with the art collection. Overall this is a great place that is close to the airport.
reviews.title: Absolutely Outstanding !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our plane was delayed in Denver and we missed our connection and were put up here by United Airlines. What a pleasant surprise. The rooms were first class and the service was good. Room service was outstanding. A great hotel should!
reviews.title: 1st day of my honeymoon was spent here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a room here on hotwire.com so we didn't know what we were getting except that it was something like a 4 or 4.5 star room near the Rosemont Theatre where we were going to see River Dance. The hotel ended up being right next door to the Theater (and many other attractions) so we could walk. We loved the design of the room and found it incredibly comfortable. The service was also excellent. We also walked down stair and out the door to have a fantastic dinner at the Capital Grille. Of course, there is a price associated with all this, but we could tell the price made a difference.
reviews.title: Loved the location, loved the room

reviews.text: After a scheduling screw-up by United Airlines, I was forced to spend the night in Chicago. They gave me a discount voucher for several hotels. I checked the Trip Advisor reviews and decided to "splurge" on the most expensive one, at $74/night! This hotel is brand new, very modern decor, would easily be $400+/night in places like LA (where I live). It made my whole situation feel a lot better! If you are going to be staying near O'Hare, this is THE hotel!!!
reviews.title: Best Hotel for the Money I've Ever Stayed At!

reviews.text: My problem with airport hotels is that I tend to have low expectations, combined with my high needs. I'm usually breaking up very, very long trips and in need of pleasing accommodations, good food and service. Which I do not often find. However, this trip (16 days, 11 airplanes, 8 different places to sleep) I lucked into the InterContinental OHare. This is a brand new hotel: the lobby is a fascinating, has the look of a very modern art gallery. The staff was especially warm, welcoming and helpful. The room was splendid: extra large, comfortable with a fun factor in the very modern bath. Step outside the door and there is a McCormick and Scmicks or a Capital Grille. Both are chains but upscale and provide very good, reliable dining experience. Delighted to discover this hotel.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel

reviews.text: Wonderful hotel almost new (only 1 year since opening), very professional and efficient staff, wonderful location and near two good restaurants right outside the hotel. The hotel facilities are impecable and looks brand new.
reviews.title: I had a great stay!

reviews.text: Very modern and luxurious hotel close to O'Hare (free shuttle).
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel In Rosemont (NOT Chicago)

reviews.text: I stayed here for a 6 day work conference in August 2009. I absolutely loved this hotel !
reviews.title: Terrible location if planning on sightseeing

reviews.text: I experienced the worst sound insulation of any airport hotel in the last 4 years. I even checked if the windows were open. The noise of the close-by freeway and the aircraft kept me from a sound sleep. The bed sheets had some old stains, which had not come out in the laundry. The shower head which was advertised as 'waterfall' shower head was so clogged up, that it sprinkled erratically all over the place, the sink was some pseudo modern, but rather impractical design, the 'fancy' coffeemaker, once found below the TV and dragged out and connected, did not work. The second coffee maker, instantly provided and started by the very friendly staff, did not work either, so I gave up. I finally got over the illusion, that expensive means everyday stuff like free wireless internet or drinkable water should be included. Even the ballpens were so cheap, they did not write properly.
reviews.title: Way too noisy

reviews.text: I will not recommend this hotel to anybody and won't stay there ever again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but worth the money?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is way overrated,
reviews.title: Great room, great price, great location...

reviews.text: The hotel was nice, but a bit too expensive for our taste. We have no problems staying at nice hotels, but there was nothing special about this one. The very few restaurants were high end, you could not get a simple sandwich or meal. The safe in the room did not work. Parking had to be paid for which was not surprising, but if you went to one of the "chain" hotels about two miles away parking was included as was a continental breakfast. The cost was almost $100.00 less a night also. The conference rooms were kept extremely cool and getting the shuttle from the airport to the hotel was extremely time consuming (it took 45 minutes after we arrived outside for the shuttle bus and it was full. Many people had to wait another 45 minutes.) The concierge told one of the non business travelers in our group that there was a museum they could see. They waited for a shuttle bus and when they got there the museum had been closed for over a year. Would be nice to get accurate information from the person you are supposed to trust at the hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel!

reviews.text: The hotel is definitely "high end" in looks, and the room was fine, but simply not worth the money.
reviews.title: Great Amenities and Service near Chicago O'Hare

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I should apparentlly add that this is in Rosemont, next to Ohare Airport, and the HUGE Rosemont Convention Center. It is NOT in Chicago, nor would I even suggest you stay here if you are traveling to Chicago... I only point this out because a previous reviewer was negative, and said it was "too far from Navy Pier.." Yeah, well so is my house !
reviews.title: Hotel is nice, Location is not!

reviews.text: To cut a long story short we ended up here as had to fly to US 1 day early, our destination was actually from Heathrow to Washington but all flights had been overbooked. We arrived weary at about 7pm and to be honest we were so knackered that we didn't see alot of the hotel as it was literally to stay till 5am the following morning before our flight to Washington.
reviews.title: Wish my stay had been longer

reviews.text: However, this hotel is fantastic. Modern, plush, clean, great staff, big rooms, lovely bathrooms. No complaints whatsoever. My only complaint was we couldn't stay any longer. I will be back I hope.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not up to InterContinental standard...

description: InterContinental Chicago O hare is the area s first luxury hotel with its very own art gallery featuring a full-time curator and monthly art exhibitions. The works of Chicago's most intriguing artists are displayed throughout the hotel. After dinner enjoy live entertainment in our very own Montrose Theatre. Architecture buffs will enjoy a visit to the Frank Lloyd Wright Home while sports fans can attend a game at nearby Wrigley Field. We are located just minutes from O Hare International Airport and 14 miles west of downtown Chicago, making us the perfect destination for business and conference guests.
